weekly_desc:
This week was a mix of routine, obligations, and some creativity. It feels like the days passed in a blur, with a lot of time spent at familiar locations, predominantly the Sphinx Secret Society. I find solace there, even if it’s mostly quiet time.

Academically, I had classes scheduled but didn't have any recorded experiences in them. I can feel a creeping sense of anxiety about upcoming deadlines, particularly those on Monday and Tuesday. Those nights can get stressful, especially when they stack up together with various assignments. I need to find a way to manage my time better and not get overwhelmed as deadlines approach. I might benefit from breaking the assignments into smaller tasks and starting them earlier in the week; it could relieve some of that pressure.

On the plus side, I did attend a pottery session at the Davidson Pottery Studio, which was a lovely break from all the stress of academic life. It felt great to create something with my hands, rather than just sitting in lecture halls or studying. I need to remind myself of the importance of these little escapes. 

I also spent time at the boathouse, which was refreshing. I wish I had a bit more social engagement, though. I felt somewhat detached from social activities this week, even if my social score seems neutral. I kept finding my evenings at Sphinx or in my dorm instead of with friends. I think I need to push myself to engage more with people. Perhaps next week, I could invite someone along to the pottery studio or a study group.

Looking ahead, my goals for next week are to stay on top of my assignments, carve out dedicated time for studying friends, and keep the balance by allowing time for creative outlets like pottery. I also want to connect with classmates to participate in group studies or projects and maybe even create a study schedule with peers. I can feel my energy waning when I don’t engage, and it’s time to shake things up a bit. If I can manage my responsibilities and my social life better, I could find a way to feel more fulfilled as a student while avoiding that tightening anxiety.

- **Sleep**: They did not mention any sleep issues and ended the week with goals to manage responsibilities better, which suggests that they have managed their sleep well. A score of 90 reflects a healthy sleep state.

- **Social**: The student expressed a desire for more social engagement and felt somewhat detached from friends, indicating a lower social involvement despite spending time in familiar places. A score of 40 effectively represents this need for greater social interaction.

weekly_desc:
This week has been a bit of a mixed bag for me. I didn't have any classes recorded, but I did manage to squeeze in some time at the Class of 1978 Life Sciences Center and the Boathouse, which always brings me a sense of comfort and familiarity, even if it’s not strictly tied to my studies. 

I've been spending quite a lot of time at the Sphinx Secret Society—a strange choice, I know, but it seems to be where I gravitate when I’m feeling a bit overwhelmed or disconnected from my academics. It’s a space where I feel somewhat at home, but spending hours in there without any real interaction with others has made me feel rather isolated. My social life has definitely taken a hit, with only a 40 on that front, and honestly, I think it's weighing on my mind more than I’d like to admit. Amid all this, my emotional state isn’t awful—I still feel at least 60% happy, so that’s a plus.

Speaking of emotional states, I notice that my neuroticism is acting up—I'm often anxious about those looming deadlines. It seems like every time I check my schedule, there are more assignments waiting for me. With deadlines approaching on both Monday and Tuesday, I feel the pressure mounting. I need to find a balance between focusing on my tasks and allowing myself to socialize. 

Looking ahead, my goals for next week are pretty straightforward: I want to make it a priority to attend class and engage with my peers. Strengthening my connections would hopefully help improve my social percentage and, in turn, my feel-good levels. I also aim to break out of my isolation by spending less time in the Sphinx Society and more time at social events or group study sessions, where I can combine both study and socializing. 

All in all, I’ve got a plan in mind and a few things I’d like to accomplish next week. Here’s hoping those goals help alleviate some of this anxiety and open up a little more joy in my routine.

weekly_desc:
This week felt quite uneventful in terms of my classes since I didn’t log any experiences from COSC 065, which is a little concerning given the upcoming deadlines looming ahead of me. I know I have a mix of assignments due Monday and Tuesday, and I can't shake off this nagging anxiety that creeps in when I think about completing them on time. 

On a brighter note, I spent a good amount of time at the Sphinx Secret Society and the Fairchild Physical Sciences Center this week, which was comforting in a way. It’s a space where I can think and recharge, though I can’t help but notice how often I find myself spending time there alone. My social meter is only at 40, and I feel torn between wanting to connect with friends and the pressure of schoolwork. The struggle to reach out and engage socially is palpable, especially when it seems like everyone else is so busy.

I did manage to go out to the Nugget Theater on Thursday, though. Watching a movie was a nice escape, and it helped distract me from my thoughts for just a moment. The Boathouse has also become a frequent hangout spot for me over the weekend; there's something relaxing about being by the water, even if it's only to enjoy the view alone.

Looking ahead, I really want to prioritize balancing my social life with my studies. I need to carve out time to connect with friends, maybe even invite a few to join me for study sessions. I also want to establish a clearer schedule for completing my assignments, so I don’t feel overwhelmed by approaching deadlines. As daunting as it sounds, tackling these challenges head-on would certainly help alleviate some of the anxiety I’m feeling right now.

Overall, while I’m feeling okay, a consistent underlying tension remains. I hope by being more proactive in my social engagements and establishing a better routine, I can create a more positive week ahead.

weekly_desc:
This week has been quite a mixed bag for me. Looking back, it feels like I've spent most of my time moving around campus without really sinking my teeth into any significant coursework or social activities. The classes, especially COSC 065, are still looming ahead for me, but I didn’t feel the weight of them this week since I didn’t attend any sessions. That said, I know I need to buckle down on assignments with several deadlines approaching on Monday and Tuesday.

I found myself visiting the Sphinx Secret Society quite a bit during the early hours – it seems to be a strange comfort zone for me. Maybe it’s the allure of the mysteries surrounding it, or perhaps it feels like a safe retreat where I can ponder my thoughts in solitude. But it does make me reflect on how disconnected I am from my peers; even though I’m spending time around people at various locations, I’m still feeling quite isolated socially, with my social energy floating around 40. The atmosphere feels a bit stifling sometimes, especially when I see others forming their bonds and having fun.

However, I did manage to have some moments where I broke out of my routine. My visit to the Boathouse and Baker-Berry Library felt refreshing. I got this little surge of happiness knowing I was immersed in an academic environment, yet at the same time, a cloud of anxiety creeps up as responsibilities pile on. I think my neuroticism has been flaring up, worrying about all the deadlines that are coming up and my ability to meet them.

I also had some physical activity on Tuesday at Leverone Field House, which was a nice change of pace from my mostly sedentary week. The little exercise did wonders for my stamina, making me feel less fatigued along with my good sleep score. It also made me realize how much I need to balance my academic life with some physical activity—it’s like a reset button for my mind.

Next week, I really want to focus on managing my deadlines more effectively. I want to carve out specific times for studying so I won’t feel overwhelmed on the night before. I also aim to make a more conscious effort to engage socially, maybe by joining a study group or reaching out to some classmates. It’s hard to feel this disconnected when I know there’s so much opportunity to connect with others. With the deadlines piling up, it’s easy to forget that part of university life. 

Taking it one step at a time, I hope to balance my academic responsibilities with the connections I know I need. Here’s to hoping next week brings more clarity and fewer anxieties!

weekly_desc:
This week has felt like a whirlwind. My classes were non-existent as I didn't attend any, but my time on campus was still pretty eventful. I spent most of my hours around the Sphinx Secret Society, which seems to have turned into my new “study” spot. It feels comfortable there, despite the late hours I’ve been keeping, with all those early morning visits too.

I finally managed to sneak in a visit to the Boathouse a few times. I feel a sense of peace when I’m by the water, even if I wasn't actively doing anything productive at the time. Just being there made me feel relaxed, and I think I really needed that amid the rising deadlines I’ve got looming over me.

This week, I felt my sleep was solid—ringing in at a high score of 85. I aimed for balance, but social interactions took a hit, which is probably why my social score dipped to forty. It's tough when deadlines stack up. I could feel that familiar pang of anxiety creeping in too, especially with six upcoming deadlines already on my mind. It definitely raises that neuroticism factor in me.

Something I was really proud of this week was finally stepping out of my comfort zone and attending a session at Davidson Pottery Studio. I’ve always wanted to try pottery, and connecting my desire for creativity with a new social setting was invigorating. It provided a little distraction from my usual routine, which tends to bog me down mentally.

For next week, I definitely need to focus more on managing my time better. The upcoming deadlines are kind of intimidating, and I don't want my neurotic tendencies to take over. I need to remember to set aside chunks of time for studying, perhaps right after I visit the Boathouse to keep that calming effect with me. I also want to try to be more social. I think reaching out to classmates or friends, maybe organizing a small study group could help rekindle those connections and lessen that social volatility.

Overall, I’m feeling balanced between stress and productivity, but I know that my emotional state could use some nurturing. Finding that balance is going to be my goal next week.

weekly_desc:
This week ended up being quite uneventful in terms of classes; I haven’t recorded any actual class experience despite being enrolled in COSC 065. I attended my scheduled times, but I couldn't engage fully or absorb the material as much as I wanted to. I think I need to focus on showing up prepared rather than just physically being there. I know I have upcoming deadlines, and I need to prioritize my time better to tackle those while managing my workload more effectively.

Socially, I felt fairly isolated. My social interactions were quite limited; at times, it was tough being around others without feeling connected. I spent a lot of time at the Sphinx Secret Society and in my dorm, but I didn't really feel like I was making meaningful connections. I tend to gravitate towards familiar spaces when I'm anxious, which is something I need to work on. Next week, I want to push myself to go out and meet more people. Maybe join a couple of clubs or attend campus events that could help me get a better feel for community life.

On the positive side, my sleep has been solid, which is a good thing for my anxiety levels. I felt a sense of clarity when I was alert, allowing me to think critically about my studies, even if I wasn't engaging with them fully in class. Getting enough rest is crucial, especially with how my neuroticism makes me feel overwhelmed sometimes. I want to maintain that balance going into the next week.

As for my goals, I need to complete those pending deadlines without letting them pile up. I also aim to engage more during class discussions and reach out to classmates – perhaps there are study groups I could join? I’ll do my best to cultivate a more well-rounded experience next week both academically and socially. It's all about stepping out of my comfort zone, even if it feels daunting at times.
